doc.field: - [MAI Plc], the financial services and advertising group, has asked S.G. Warburg and Co Ltd to arrange a 100 mln dlr multiple option facility which will restructure a part of the company's exisiting banking arrangements, banking sources said. The financing will be for five years and involves a committed backstop facility and an uncommitted tender panel for cash advances in dollars or other available currencies. The committed part of the transaction will carry a facility fee of 7.5 basis points and drawings will be at a margin of 15 basis points. There also will be a utilization fee of five basis points if the underwriting banks are called upon to provide more than 30 pct of the facility.
